study_plan_entry.title: Topics in Group Representation Theory II

free_text.Content: - Reflection Groups and Related Objects in Representation Theory:[br/]Complex reflection groups, classification, invariant rings, Chevalley theorem, braid groups, cyclotomic Hecke algebras, monodromy representations, relation with the theory of groups of Lie type, Cherednik algebras, open problems.[br/]Bibliography:[br/]-Michel Broué: Introduction to complex reflection groups and their braid groups. Lecture Notes in Mathematics, 1988. Springer-Verlag, Berlin, 2010. [br/]-Gustav I. Lehrer, Donald E. Taylor: Unitary reflection groups. Australian Mathematical Society Lecture Series, 20. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 2009.[br/]-Richard Kane: Reflection groups and invariant theory. CMS Books in Mathematics/Ouvrages de Mathématiques de la SMC, 5. Springer-Verlag, New York, 2001.[br/]- Introduction to the modular representation theory of finite groups: character theory, Brauer's main theorems, blocks as finite dimensional algebras, fusion systems. The emphasis will be on the local-global principles underlying the subject. Open problems in the area will be dis- cussed.[br/]References: [br/]- Curtis and Reiner, Methods of Representation theory, I, II, Wiley Interscience, 1987 [br/]- T. Nagao, Y. Tshumima, Representations of finite groups, Academic Press, 1989 [br/]- Fusion systems in algebra and topology, M. Aschbacher, B. Oliver, R. Kessar, CUP, 2011.[br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: basic group theory and representation theory
